quiz.title: Possessive 's - A1 Level
quiz.description: Master possessive 's with singular and plural nouns at A1 level.

questions.explanation: Use 's after a singular name to show possession.
questions.hint: How do you show that something belongs to John?

questions.explanation: Use 's after a singular noun to show possession.
questions.hint: How do you show that something belongs to the teacher?

questions.explanation: Use 's after a singular name to show possession.
questions.hint: How do you show that something belongs to Mary?

questions.explanation: Use 's after irregular plural nouns to show possession.
questions.hint: Children is already plural. How do you add possession?

questions.prompt: The ____ books are on the shelf. (students)
questions.explanation: Use ' (apostrophe only) after regular plural nouns ending in 's'.
questions.hint: Students already ends in 's'. How do you add possession?

questions.explanation: Use 's after a singular name to show possession.
questions.hint: How do you show that something belongs to Tom?

questions.explanation: Use 's after a singular noun to show possession.
questions.hint: How do you show that something belongs to the manager?

questions.explanation: Use ' (apostrophe only) after regular plural nouns ending in 's'.
questions.hint: Girls already ends in 's'. How do you add possession?

questions.explanation: Use 's after a singular name to show possession.
questions.hint: How do you show that something belongs to Peter?

questions.explanation: Use 's after a singular noun to show possession.
questions.hint: How do you show that something belongs to the cat?

questions.explanation: Use ' (apostrophe only) after regular plural nouns ending in 's'.
questions.hint: Boys already ends in 's'. How do you add possession?

questions.explanation: Use 's after a singular name to show possession.
questions.hint: How do you show that something belongs to Sarah?

questions.explanation: Use 's after irregular plural nouns to show possession.
questions.hint: Women is already plural. How do you add possession?

questions.explanation: Use 's after a singular noun to show possession.
questions.hint: How do you show that something belongs to the dog?

questions.explanation: Use ' (apostrophe only) after regular plural nouns ending in 's'.
questions.hint: Teachers already ends in 's'. How do you add possession?

questions.explanation: Use 's after a singular name to show possession.
questions.hint: How do you show that something belongs to David?

questions.prompt: The ____ nest is in the tree. (bird)
questions.explanation: Use 's after a singular noun to show possession.
questions.hint: How do you show that something belongs to the bird?

questions.explanation: Use ' (apostrophe only) after regular plural nouns ending in 's'.
questions.hint: Tourists already ends in 's'. How do you add possession?

questions.explanation: Use 's after a singular name to show possession.
questions.hint: How do you show that something belongs to Emma?

questions.explanation: Use 's after irregular plural nouns to show possession.
questions.hint: Men is already plural. How do you add possession?

questions.explanation: Use 's after a singular noun to show possession.
questions.hint: How do you show that something belongs to the cat?

questions.explanation: Use ' (apostrophe only) after regular plural nouns ending in 's'.
questions.hint: Nurses already ends in 's'. How do you add possession?

questions.explanation: Use 's after singular names, even if they end in 's'.
questions.hint: James is singular. How do you add possession?

questions.explanation: Use 's after a singular noun to show possession.
questions.hint: How do you show that something belongs to the butterfly?

questions.explanation: Use ' (apostrophe only) after regular plural nouns ending in 's'.
questions.hint: Secretaries already ends in 's'. How do you add possession?

questions.explanation: Use 's after a singular name to show possession.
questions.hint: How do you show that something belongs to Lisa?

questions.explanation: Use 's after a singular noun to show possession.
questions.hint: How do you show that something belongs to the rabbit?

questions.explanation: Use ' (apostrophe only) after regular plural nouns ending in 's'.
questions.hint: Artists already ends in 's'. How do you add possession?

questions.explanation: Use 's after a singular name to show possession.
questions.hint: How do you show that something belongs to Michael?

questions.explanation: Use ' (apostrophe only) after regular plural nouns ending in 's'.
questions.hint: Horses already ends in 's'. How do you add possession?

questions.explanation: Use 's after a singular noun to show possession.
questions.hint: How do you show that something belongs to the baby?

questions.explanation: Use 's after irregular plural nouns to show possession.
questions.hint: People is already plural. How do you add possession?

questions.explanation: Use 's after a singular name to show possession.
questions.hint: How do you show that something belongs to Anna?

questions.explanation: Use 's after a singular noun to show possession.
questions.hint: How do you show that something belongs to the bull?

questions.explanation: Use ' (apostrophe only) after regular plural nouns ending in 's'.
questions.hint: Doctors already ends in 's'. How do you add possession?

questions.explanation: Use 's after singular names, even if they end in 's'.
questions.hint: Charles is singular. How do you add possession?

questions.prompt: The ____ stripes are black and white. (zebra)
questions.explanation: Use 's after a singular noun to show possession.
questions.hint: How do you show that something belongs to the zebra?

questions.explanation: Use ' (apostrophe only) after regular plural nouns ending in 's'.
questions.hint: Musicians already ends in 's'. How do you add possession?

questions.explanation: Use 's after a singular name to show possession.
questions.hint: How do you show that something belongs to Robert?

questions.explanation: Use 's after singular nouns. 'Sheep' is the same in singular and plural.
questions.hint: This sheep is singular. How do you add possession?

questions.explanation: Use ' (apostrophe only) after regular plural nouns ending in 's'.
questions.hint: Firefighters already ends in 's'. How do you add possession?

questions.explanation: Use 's after a singular name to show possession.
questions.hint: How do you show that something belongs to Jessica?

questions.explanation: Use 's after singular nouns. 'Deer' is the same in singular and plural.
questions.hint: This deer is singular. How do you add possession?

questions.explanation: Use ' (apostrophe only) after regular plural nouns ending in 's'.
questions.hint: Designers already ends in 's'. How do you add possession?
